subject: Design
title: Dyson Bladeless Fan: Reinventing Airflow
description: A micro-lesson that makes Dyson Bladeless Fan: Reinventing Airflow usable.

hook.text: James Dyson spent 15 years and made 5,127 prototypes before his bagless vacuum worked. Then he reinvented the fan.

buildup.text: Traditional fans chop air with blades, creating buffeting. Dyson asked: what if there were no blades at all?

discovery.text: Air Multiplier draws air through a base and amplifies it over an airfoil ring â€” smooth, uninterrupted airflow.

twist.text: Critics called it overpriced at $300. Dyson proved premium industrial design could command luxury pricing.

climax.text: Dyson's approach shows that questioning the most basic assumptions creates breakthrough design.

punchline.text: The best inventions come from asking why we accept bad design.

quiz.question: How many prototypes did James Dyson make for his vacuum?
